intro: Aconogonon coriarium, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Aconogonon coriarium is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
